channel.title: CVE Feed for MainWP -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for MainWP -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-3132|2024-08-02T06:48:07.872Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20%E2%80%93%20securely%20connects%20sites%20to%20the%20mainwp%20wordpress%20manager%20dashboard
item.description: The MainWP Child plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in versions up to, and including, 4.4.1.1 due to insufficient controls on the storage of back-up files. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data including the entire installations database if a backup occurs and the deletion of the back-up files fail.

item.title: CVE-2024-1642|2024-08-01T18:48:21.690Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20dashboard%20%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20manager%20for%20multiple%20websites%20maintenance
item.description: The MainWP Dashboard – WordPress Manager for Multiple Websites Maintenance plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.0.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'posting_bulk' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete arbitrary posts via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-23649|2024-07-09T13:21:15.821Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20links%20manager%20extension
item.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Links Manager Extension.This issue affects MainWP Links Manager Extension: from n/a through 2.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-33680|2024-06-04T17:44:41.018Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Child Reports.This issue affects MainWP Child Reports: from n/a through 2.1.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-1642|2024-03-13T15:26:41.285Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20dashboard%20%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20manager%20for%20multiple%20websites%20maintenance
item.description: The MainWP Dashboard – WordPress Manager for Multiple Websites Maintenance plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.0.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'posting_bulk' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete arbitrary posts via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2023-23640|2024-06-10T19:00:57.429Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20updraftplus%20extension
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MainWP MainWP UpdraftPlus Extension.This issue affects MainWP UpdraftPlus Extension: from n/a through 4.0.6.

item.title: CVE-2023-23656|2024-03-26T19:51:56.582Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20file%20uploader%20extension
item.description: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type vulnerability in MainWP MainWP File Uploader Extension.This issue affects MainWP File Uploader Extension: from n/a through 4.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-23645|2024-06-04T17:22:26.940Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20code%20snippets%20extension
item.description: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Code Snippets Extension allows Code Injection.This issue affects MainWP Code Snippets Extension: from n/a through 4.0.2.

item.title: CVE-2023-23649|2024-03-28T06:12:22.156Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20links%20manager%20extension
item.description: Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Links Manager Extension.This issue affects MainWP Links Manager Extension: from n/a through 2.1.

item.title: CVE-2023-23639|2024-06-10T13:33:42.179Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20staging%20extension
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Staging Extension.This issue affects MainWP Staging Extension: from n/a through 4.0.3.

item.title: CVE-2023-22699|2024-06-04T17:26:47.825Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20wordfence%20extension
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Wordfence Extension.This issue affects MainWP Wordfence Extension: from n/a through 4.0.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-1642|2024-07-25T13:20:27.540Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20dashboard%20%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20manager%20for%20multiple%20websites%20maintenance
item.description: The MainWP Dashboard – WordPress Manager for Multiple Websites Maintenance plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.0.1. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'posting_bulk' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete arbitrary posts via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-33680|2024-08-02T02:36:04.567Z -- mainwp -- mainwp%20child%20reports
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in MainWP MainWP Child Reports.This issue affects MainWP Child Reports: from n/a through 2.1.1.
